main event: Observers reported seeing round silver fireballs moving at a high rate of speed and erratic course in Oak Park, Illinois on March 16, 1954.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 2-3 minutes,Two civilian observers noted the absence of radar pickup for the sighted objects,The objects were described as 'message bearers',Conclusions included possibilities of the objects being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature,Another UFO sighting was reported by members of the 755th AACW Squadron on March 17, 1954, involving a bright metallic disc-shaped object.
